title: Ticket #4814: tools that -format should support an un-evaluated value format tag
description:
In some cases when using -format or -autoformat, it is desired that the value be printed without first being evaluated. This is usually the case for Requirements, for instance. With the current code "%s" will sometimes print unevaluated raw, but can't be relied on to do this in all cases. The only way to get this format is to use -long or to pass unparse(attr) as the attribute name to format.

We should have a new format tag %r (for raw or round-trip), that prints out the same thing for the value as -long would. When using -autoformat, -af:r will use the %r format for all printing, instead of %v or %V that it currently uses.
